com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation

Class SVKeyFrameAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation.SVAnimation
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation.SVKeyFrameAnimation

  • public class SVKeyFrameAnimation
extends SVAnimation
    This class implements keyframe animation. You can specify keyframes in the time range 0.0f to 1.0f to control the animation. You can add any number of keyframes. Key frame entered must be bigger than previous key frame value. (etc. 0.0f -> 0.5f -> 1.0f)

    As shown below VisualView throws exception if time values are not in order or out of the range.


    IllegalArgumentException<-- (0.0f)-+--+--+-(0.2)--+--+--+--+-(0.5)--+-..So..on..--+-(1.0f) ---> IllegalArgumentException

    - - - - ---------------- -startkeyProperty()<--------addKeyProperty()---------->endKeyProperty()- ----------- - -

    • Method Detail

      • addKeyProperty

        public void addKeyProperty(float keyTime,
                  float value)
        Add a new animation key property to the animation with the specified key time and float value. Use this method for properties with only one float value such as light angle. You can enter values between time between 0.0f and 1.0f. If the property type take the value as float[] then you should use the overloaded function.

        Parameters:
        keyTime - The time in the range 0.0f to 1.0f.
        value - The value at the given time (like opacity,cornerRadius ,..etc)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the animation type takes an array as its argument. or if the time is invalid
        See Also:
        SVAnimation

      • addKeyProperty

        public void addKeyProperty(float keyTime,
                  float[] value)
        Add value of animation at given time.If the animation type take the value as float then use the overloaded function.

        Parameters:
        keyTime - The key-frame time with the following input validation otherwise Exception will be thrown

        1.) Can't take negative value neither value greater then 1.0f

        2.) Value should be greater then the previous value

        3.) Value should be between 0.0f and 1.0f. For 0.0f use startKeyProperty() and endKeyProperty for 1.0f

        value - The float array value for the slide property at the keyframe (for example, color, region or rotation) see the list of slide properties in the SVAnimation class for more information.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if animation type doesn't take array as its argument or has the mismatched array length or if the input time is invalid

      • startKeyProperty

        public void startKeyProperty(float value)
        Enter Value at Key-time(0.0f).

        The function throws exception if the animation type takes the value as float[].use Overloaded Function otherwise

        Parameters:
        value - The float value for the slide property at time 0.0f (for example opacity or corner radius), see the list of slide properties in the SVAnimation class for more information.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if animation property type takes array as its argument.
        See Also:
        SVAnimation

      • startKeyProperty

        The function throws exception if the animation type takes the value as float.

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        See Also:

      • endKeyProperty

        public void endKeyProperty(float value)
        Enter value of animation at Time(1.0f).

        The function throws exception if the animation type takes the value as float array.

        Parameters:
        value - Value at the keyframe (like opacity,cornerRadius ,..etc)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if animation property type takes array as its argument.
        See Also:
        SVAnimation

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        See Also:

      • isKeyFrameTimeValid

        public boolean isKeyFrameTimeValid()
        check if the KeyFrameTime is Valid. The KeyFrameTime should lie between 0.0f to 1.0f for the smooth transition of animation. Any Value other then this throws exception and there will be no animation.
        Returns:
        boolean true if Valid , Exception otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If invalid time values

        1. if the values at time 0.0 is not given. (user must use startKeyProperty() for the same)

        2. if the values at time 1.0 is not given. (user must use EndKeyProperty() for the same)

        3. if time values is not in ascending order (must follow 0.0 < 0.2 <0.5 < 1.0f)

        4. if the time values is out of the range. (must be 0.0f < Time < 1.0f)
